enrichment.AboutCourse:
Our training course starts in late August through to July.  It has been designed by teachers to reflect the needs of the modern classroom.\r
\r
Our programme offers:\r
\r
•\tAfter the interview day, we will meet with you to discuss your Individual Development Plan which identifies your strengths and areas requiring further development seen on the interview day.  We will also set some tasks and a reading list to ensure you have every opportunity to develop your knowledge and skills to be ready to start the course.\r
•\tYou will be invited to an Orientation Day to meet your peers and course staff\r
•\tOur interactive workshops cover all the primary curriculum subjects in detail.  \r
\r
We also have workshops covering:\r
\r
•\tChild Development\r
•\tPlanning and Assessment\r
•\tBehaviour Management and Special Educational Needs\r
•\tSafeguarding\r
•\tEnglish as an Additional Language\r
•\tTeacher and the Law\r
•\tWellbeing\r
•\tVoice Care\r
•\tSchool workload\r
•\tOpportunity to gain certificates in PE and Safeguarding recognised by the Teaching Profession\r
\r
All our sessions are based either at our training centre in Wickford or in neighbouring primary schools. You will also visit a special school, pupil referral unit, hindu temple and an inner London school.\r
\r
School Placements\r
\r
You will spend 75% of the course in school.  Each week you will receive tutorials delivered by the Headteacher and your class mentor.  These tutorials link to the workshops.\r
\r
You will start undertaking structured observations of teachers followed by team teaching, part lesson then full lesson teaching.\r
\r
Assessment\r
\r
During the course you will be continually assessed against the Teachers’ Standards in the following ways:\r
\r
•\tThrough observation of your lessons\r
•\tThrough examination of your portfolio of evidence\r
•\tThrough assessment tasks\r
•\tThrough your reflections of your journey to become a teacher linking theory from workshops to your practice in the classroom\r
\r
There is a formal review of your progress at the end of each term, with the final assessment to gain Qualified Teacher Status taking place in the third term.\r
\r
Course workload\r
\r
We make sure that any written submissions are evenly spread throughout the course.  We issue a weekly newsletter to all trainees keeping them updated of deadlines.  We operate an ‘open door’ policy to ensure trainees can discuss any issues or worries.\r
\r
Our course has been rated by Ofsted as ‘Outstanding’ for 12 years.  We believe we offer excellent value for money.\r
enrichment.Qualifications:
•\tGCSE grade C (or grade 4) in English Language, Mathematics and Science\r
•\tMinimum 2:2 honours degree from a UK university or a recognised equivalent qualification\r
\r
If you have non-British qualifications, you will need to verify their equivalence through UK NARIC, tel: 01242 260010.  You will need to supply written evidence of any equivalencies with your application.\r
\r
If you do not hold English, Mathematics or Science GSCE qualifications (or a recognised equivalent), then you will need to take an equivalency test.  We recommend www.equivalencytesting.co.uk.\r
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Once we receive your application, we will interview you in one of our partner schools.  You will be interviewed by us and a member of school staff.  \r
\r
On the interview day, you will be asked to:\r
\r
•\tundertake a formal interview;\r
•\tdeliver a 10 minute presentation on an aspect of learning which is either misunderstood by pupils or difficult to teach;\r
•\tcomplete a written task reflecting on a lesson that you have observed a teacher deliver;\r
•\tdeliver a 10 minute creative activity to the class where you have just observed the teacher.\r
\r
Successful candidates will be offered a place within 24 hours of the interview day.  An offer letter will be issued and may detail some conditions, e.g. passing your degree.\r
\r
All trainees offered a place must:\r
\r
•\tpass the literacy and numeracy professional skills tests;\r
•\tpass a Fitness to Teach medical assessment;\r
•\tundergo an enhanced DBS check to verify their suitability to work with young people.\r
\r
You will then attend a meeting with the Course Director to discuss the strengths and areas for further development identified on the interview day.  Tasks will also be set with reading lists.\r
\r
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
You need to be:\r
\r
•\timaginative, energetic and creative;\r
•\tenthusiastic about teaching;\r
•\thardworking, adaptable and flexible;\r
•\twell organised, focused and determined;\r
\r
•\thave a positive outlook;\r
•\thave a resilient nature;\r
•\thave an ability to inspire and enthuse;\r
•\thave the ability to work in a team and with other adults;\r
•\thave the ability to reflect, listen and are willing to act on advice;\r
•\thave the ability to use their initiative\r
\r
These qualities are developed on the course through interactive workshops, which previous trainees have greatly valued. \r
\r
You are learning all the time.\r
\r
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
We spend considerable time in ensuring that your placement school is within a reasonable travelling distance from your home.  We know our school mentors very well and try to match our trainees with their mentor to build that strong professional relationship.\r
\r
If you wish to nominate a school, we will be pleased to talk to the Headteacher about our programme.\r
\r
You will be teaching across the age range 5-11 \r
\r
All our headteachers are passionate about ‘growing their own’ staff and are very committed to our programme.  We work with over 50 primary schools, as they acknowledge we produce excellent Newly Qualified Teachers who are fully prepared for the challenges of the modern classroom.\r
\r
Each trainee will be placed in the same school for the whole year, apart from a 6 week period spent in a different school.  This second placement will be in the alternative key stage and will be in a contrasting school environment.  Our schools comprise of small/large primaries, faith schools, small/large infant/junior schools.\r
\r
In addition, we provide experiences at special schools, pupil referral units, a Hindu temple and teaching in a class with a high proportion of pupils with English as an additional language.\r
\r
Schools play such an important part in the programme, and that’s why we can provide you with an outstanding foundation on which to build your future career.\r
\r

inst.TrainWithUs:
Join our well-structured, supportive School-Centred Initial Teacher Training course. \r
\r
At the end of the course, our trainees say that they feel confident and fully prepared to start their teaching career.\r
\r
100% of our trainees gain employment, and enjoy the benefit of our support into their first teaching post and beyond.\r
\r
Our course offers great value for money – we deliver quality workshops, carefully identified placements, individual pastoral support and academic support in writing assignments. Our focus is on you as an individual, providing you with a tailor-made training programme.\r
\r
We offer:\r
\r
•\ta training programme that has been rated ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted for the past 12 years and placed in the top five of the ‘Good Teacher Training Guide’ for the past 10 years;\r
•\texperienced school mentors who are passionate about developing outstanding and confident Newly Qualified Teachers;\r
•\tengaging workshops delivered by outstanding and knowledgeable teachers, providing you with a wealth of ideas to inspire pupil learning;\r
•\topportunities to build your confidence in diverse settings, e.g. special school, pupil referral unit and an inner city school where you will be working with pupils with English as an additional language;\r
•\ta Postgraduate Certificate in Education, worth 60 Master credits. This provides an ideal opportunity to bring together the very best of school experience and academic study; \r
•\topportunity for you to request a school where you would like to train.\r
\r
Make us your first choice and train with the best in Essex.\r
\r
\r
inst.TrainWithDisability:
Our aim is to promote and implement an inclusive learning and teaching environment, allowing you to study independently.\r
\r
We are here to support you and would encourage you to contact us so we can help identify an ‘appropriate adjustments’ to meet your individual needs.\r
\r
Once you have applied for our course, we are available for you to contact to discuss your particular needs.  We have had trainees who have successfully passed our course with visual and hearing impairments, dyslexia, dyspraxia and autistic spectrum conditions.  \r
\r
We understand your needs and will work closely with you to ascertain the impact of your condition on your studies.  It may be you need:\r
\r
•\tdeadlines to be extended;\r
•\tworkshops to be recorded;\r
•\tpowerpoint presentations in advance of workshops\r
•\tphotocopying on coloured paper\r
•\twheelchair access\r
\r
With your permission, we will ask your mentor to work with you providing support and guidance.  We need to ensure that all elements of this training year make ‘reasonable adjustments’ to provide every opportunity for you to succeed.\r
